messageBody:
Replace these two classes with what I have, and tell me if it
still works.

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Berin Loritsch [mailto:bloritsch@...]
> Sent: Thursday, August 29, 2002 4:40 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: RE: [junit] Re: Just replaced my 3.7 jar with 3.8
>
>
> > From: ericheikkila [mailto:ericheikkila@...]
> >
> > Commented the line out and it runs fine now.
> >
> > DOH!
> >
> > So what would a better solution be?
>
>
> I have a feeling the ReloadingTestSuiteLoader wanted to
> create a new classloader each time the test was run. That
> way the test classes can be reloaded so that when Junit runs
> your tests, it is always with the most current jars/classes.
>
> In order for that to work properly, we probably need the
> setContextClassloader.
>
> Try looking at where the classloader that they are passing in
> is created. Uncomment out the line you did, and make sure
> they are creating the classloader with the context
> classloader as a parent.
>
> I just downloaded 3.8, so I can look at creating a patch soon.
>
